declarations.comments:
Definition of a color space.

* `RGB`: red, green, blue
* `HSL`: hue, saturation, lightness
* `LCh`: Lightness, chroma, hue
* `Lab`: Lightness, a, b
declarations.title: ColorSpace

declarations.comments:
The representation of a color.

Note:
- The `Eq` instance compares two `Color`s by comparing their (integer) RGB
  values. This is different from comparing the HSL values (for example,
  HSL has many different representations of black (arbitrary hue and
  saturation values).
- Colors outside the sRGB gamut which cannot be displayed on a typical
  computer screen can not be represented by `Color`.
declarations.title: Color

declarations.comments:
Create a `Color` from XYZ coordinates in the CIE 1931 color space. Note
that a `Color` always represents a color in the sRGB gamut (colors that
can be represented on a typical computer screen) while the XYZ color space
is bigger. This function will tend to create fully saturated colors at the
edge of the sRGB gamut if the coordinates lie outside the sRGB range.

See:
- https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/CIE_1931_color_space
- https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SRGB
declarations.title: xyz

declarations.comments: Pure white.
declarations.title: white

declarations.comments:
Get XYZ coordinates according to the CIE 1931 color space.

See:
- https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/CIE_1931_color_space
- https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SRGB
declarations.title: toXYZ

declarations.comments:
Convert a `Color` to its red, green, blue and alpha values. All values
are numbers in the range from 0.0 to 1.0.
declarations.title: toRGBA'

declarations.comments:
Convert a `Color` to its red, green, blue and alpha values. The RGB values
are integers in the range from 0 to 255. The alpha channel is a number
between 0.0 and 1.0.
declarations.title: toRGBA

declarations.comments:
Get L, a and b coordinates according to the Lab color space.

See: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lab_color_space
declarations.title: toLab

declarations.comments:
Get L, C and h coordinates according to the CIE LCh color space.

See: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lab_color_space
declarations.title: toLCh

declarations.comments:
Return a hexadecimal representation of the color in the form `#rrggbb`,
where `rr`, `gg` and `bb` refer to hexadecimal digits corresponding to
the RGB channel values between `00` and `ff`. The alpha channel is not
represented.
declarations.title: toHexString

declarations.comments:
Convert a `Color` to its hue, saturation, lightness and alpha values. See
`hsla` for the ranges of each channel.
declarations.title: toHSLA

declarations.comments:
Convert a color to a gray tone with the same perceived luminance (see
`luminance`).
declarations.title: toGray

declarations.comments:
Return a readable foreground text color (either `black` or `white`) for a
given background color.
declarations.title: textColor

declarations.comments:
Increase the saturation of a color by adding a certain amount (number
between -1.0 and 1.0) to the saturation channel. If the number is
negative, the color is desaturated.
declarations.title: saturate

declarations.comments: Rotate the hue of a `Color` by a certain angle (in degrees).
declarations.title: rotateHue

declarations.comments: Create a `Color` from RGB and alpha values between 0.0 and 1.0.
declarations.title: rgba'

declarations.comments:
Create a `Color` from integer RGB values between 0 and 255 and a floating
point alpha value between 0.0 and 1.0.
declarations.title: rgba

declarations.comments: Create a `Color` from RGB values between 0.0 and 1.0.
declarations.title: rgb'

declarations.comments: Create a `Color` from integer RGB values between 0 and 255.
declarations.title: rgb

declarations.comments:
Mix two colors by linearly interpolating between them in the specified
color space. For the HSL colorspace, the shortest path is chosen along the
circle of hue values.
declarations.title: mix

declarations.comments:
The relative brightness of a color (normalized to 0.0 for darkest black
and 1.0 for lightest white), according to the WCAG definition.

See: https://www.w3.org/TR/2008/REC-WCAG20-20081211/#relativeluminancedef
declarations.title: luminance

declarations.comments:
Lighten a color by adding a certain amount (number between -1.0 and 1.0)
to the lightness channel. If the number is negative, the color is
darkened.
declarations.title: lighten

declarations.comments:
Create a `Color` from lightness, chroma and hue coordinates in the CIE LCh
color space. This is a cylindrical transform of the Lab color space.
Note: See documentation for `xyz`. The same restrictions apply here.

See: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lab_color_space
declarations.title: lch

declarations.comments:
Create a `Color` from L, a and b coordinates coordinates in the Lab color
space.
Note: See documentation for `xyz`. The same restrictions apply here.

See: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lab_color_space
declarations.title: lab

declarations.comments:
Determine whether text of one color is readable on a background of a
different color (see `contrast`). This function is symmetric in both
arguments.

``` purs
isReadable c1 c2 = contrast c1 c2 > 4.5
```
declarations.title: isReadable

declarations.comments:
Determine whether a color is perceived as a light color.

``` purs
isLight c = brightness c > 0.5
```
declarations.title: isLight

declarations.comments:
Create a `Color` from hue, saturation, lightness and alpha values. The
hue is given in degrees, as a `Number` between 0.0 and 360.0. Saturation,
lightness and alpha are numbers between 0.0 and 1.0.
declarations.title: hsla

declarations.comments:
Create a `Color` from hue, saturation and lightness values. The hue is
given in degrees, as a `Number` between 0.0 and 360.0. Both saturation and
lightness are numbers between 0.0 and 1.0.
declarations.title: hsl

declarations.comments: Create a gray tone from a lightness values (0.0 is black, 1.0 is white).
declarations.title: graytone

declarations.comments:
Converts an integer to a color (RGB representation). `0` is black and
`0xffffff` is white. Values outside this range will be clamped.

This function is useful if you want to hard-code Hex values. For example:
``` purs
red = fromInt 0xff0000
```
declarations.title: fromInt

declarations.comments:
Parse a hexadecimal RGB code of the form `#rgb` or `#rrggbb`. The `#`
character is required. Each hexadecimal digit is of the form `[0-9a-fA-F]`
(case insensitive). Returns `Nothing` if the string is in a wrong format.
declarations.title: fromHexString

declarations.comments:
Compute the perceived 'distance' between two colors according to the CIE76
delta-E standard. A distance below ~2.3 is not noticable.

See: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Color_difference
declarations.title: distance

declarations.comments:
Decrease the saturation of a color by subtracting a certain amount (number
between -1.0 and 1.0) from the saturation channel. If the number is
negative, the color is saturated.
declarations.title: desaturate

declarations.comments:
Darken a color by subtracting a certain amount (number between -1.0 and
1.0) from the lightness channel. If the number is negative, the color is
lightened.
declarations.title: darken

declarations.comments: A CSS representation of the color in the form `rgb(..)` or `rgba(...)`.
declarations.title: cssStringRGBA

declarations.comments: A CSS representation of the color in the form `hsl(..)` or `hsla(...)`.
declarations.title: cssStringHSLA

declarations.comments:
The contrast ratio of two colors. A minimum contrast ratio of 4.5 is
recommended to ensure that text is readable on a colored background. The
contrast ratio is symmetric on both arguments:
`contrast c1 c2 == contrast c2 c1`.

See http://www.w3.org/TR/2008/REC-WCAG20-20081211/#contrast-ratiodef
declarations.title: contrast

declarations.comments: Get the complementary color (hue rotated by 180°).
declarations.title: complementary

declarations.comments:
The percieved brightness of the color (A number between 0.0 and 1.0).

See: https://www.w3.org/TR/AERT#color-contrast
declarations.title: brightness

declarations.comments: Pure black.
declarations.title: black

declarations.comments: Fonts.
declarations.title: Font

declarations.comments: Turn a `Font` into a `String` which can be used with `Graphics.Canvas.setFont`.
declarations.title: fontString

modules.name: Graphics.Drawing
modules.comments: This module defines a type `Drawing` for creating vector graphics.

declarations.comments: A `Point` consists of `x` and `y` coordinates.
declarations.title: Point

declarations.comments: A single shape.
declarations.title: Shape

declarations.comments: Create a path.
declarations.title: path

declarations.comments: Create a _closed_ path.
declarations.title: closed

declarations.comments: Create a rectangle from the left, top, width and height parameters.
declarations.title: rectangle

declarations.comments: Create a circle from the left, top and radius parameters.
declarations.title: circle

declarations.comments:
Create a circular arc from the left, top, start angle, end angle and
radius parameters.
declarations.title: arc

declarations.comments: Encapsulates fill color etc.
declarations.title: FillStyle

declarations.comments: Set the fill color.
declarations.title: fillColor

declarations.comments: Encapsulates outline color etc.
declarations.title: OutlineStyle

declarations.comments: Set the outline color.
declarations.title: outlineColor

declarations.comments: Set the line width.
declarations.title: lineWidth

declarations.comments: Encapsulates shadow settings etc.
declarations.title: Shadow

declarations.comments: Set the shadow color.
declarations.title: shadowColor

declarations.comments: Set the shadow blur.
declarations.title: shadowBlur

declarations.comments: Set the shadow blur.
declarations.title: shadowOffset

declarations.comments: A vector `Drawing`.
declarations.title: Drawing

declarations.comments: Fill a `Shape`.
declarations.title: filled

declarations.comments: Draw the outline of a `Shape`.
declarations.title: outlined

declarations.comments: Clip a `Drawing` to a `Shape`.
declarations.title: clipped

declarations.comments: Apply a `Shadow` to a `Drawing`.
declarations.title: shadow

declarations.comments: Apply a scale transformation by providing the x and y scale factors.
declarations.title: scale

declarations.comments: Apply a translation by providing the x and y distances.
declarations.title: translate

declarations.comments: Apply a rotation by providing the angle.
declarations.title: rotate

declarations.comments: Render some text.
declarations.title: text

declarations.comments: Modify a `Drawing` by applying a transformation to every subdrawing.
declarations.title: everywhere

declarations.comments: Render a `Drawing` to a canvas.
declarations.title: render

modules.name: Graphics.Drawing.Font
modules.comments: This module defines preset fonts, and functions for creating fonts.

declarations.comments: Fonts.
declarations.title: Font

declarations.comments: Create a `Font`.
declarations.title: font

declarations.comments: Turn a `Font` into a `String` which can be used with `Graphics.Canvas.setFont`.
declarations.title: fontString

declarations.comments: Font family.
declarations.title: FontFamily

declarations.comments: Serif font
declarations.title: serif

declarations.comments: Sans serif font
declarations.title: sansSerif

declarations.comments: Monospaced font
declarations.title: monospace

declarations.comments: Cursive font
declarations.title: cursive

declarations.comments: Fantasy font
declarations.title: fantasy

declarations.comments: Use a custom font
declarations.title: customFont

declarations.comments: Encapsulates font options.
declarations.title: FontOptions

declarations.comments: Use a bold font.
declarations.title: bold

declarations.comments: Use a bolder font.
declarations.title: bolder

declarations.comments: Use a light font.
declarations.title: light

declarations.comments: Use an italic style.
declarations.title: italic

declarations.comments: Use an oblique style.
declarations.title: oblique

declarations.comments: Use small caps.
declarations.title: smallCaps
